shapes.label: Monetary amount
shapes.comment: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

property.name: currency
property.description: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\\n\\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. \"USD\"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. \"BTC\"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. \"Ithaca HOUR\".

property.name: validFrom
property.description: The date when the item becomes valid.

property.name: validThrough
property.description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the quantitative value or property value node.\\n\\n* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.\\n* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.\\n* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.\\n* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
